newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico state says bean production up.
newsitem.headline: Mexico state says bean production up.

text.p: The Mexican state of Zacatecas will increase production of frijol beans to 405,000 tonnes in 1996, compared to 351,000 tonnes in 1995, the state agriculture director said on Wednesday.
"If weather permits...we will have 405,000 tonnes (of beans) in 1996," Zacatecas state agriculture director Marcelo Ortiz Valdes said in an interview.
Zacatecas is Mexico's leading producer of frijol beans and supplies 33 percent of the domestic market, Ortiz said.

Ortiz estimated that national production of beans for the 1996 spring-summer and autumn 1996-winter-1997 crop cycles would be 1,318,000 tonnes. This would avoid the need to import frijol beans, he said.
